title: Feature Request:  UI Improvements to Connection Tree
author: richlux
body_snippet:
mRemoteNG is a great program, but currently, it's difficult to tell which connections are active when looking at the Connections tree list.  Would it be possible to have a more obvious icon and make the text of active connections bold (see screenshot of Devolutions Remote Desktop Manager)?  Also, it would be great if the current active connection were automatically selected in the connection tree as you switch between tabs.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25157703/44827324-...

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
@sparerd I like my little Penguin icons and Windows logos currently, but I agree that it is difficult to see the connected icon that is overlayed. Maybe increasing the icon size (and proportionally increasing the overlay size).

Or since we might not want to take away the custom icons as they are actively used:
add a second icon dedicated to the connection status (if possible)
Rather than an overlay, replace the custom icon with the connected icon

Just some thoughts...

comments.author: leaskovski
comments.snippet: The switching of the selected item in the tree when you switch tab would be a great addition.  I look at the tree more than i do the tabs.  In fact, it might be an idea to hide the connection tabs if you dont want to use them

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
@richlux @kmscode We can add a setting for showing the connection status as an overlay in the tree or as the sole icon for a connection.

@leaskovski Interesting idea, i like it. Would you mind opening a separate issue to track it?
